name: Eroding Avatar of Lava
desc:
A strange monster that must continually absorb heat to stay in an active state.
The ancient civilization used many different types of golden designs to drive the flow of phlogiston, allowing massive constructs and magnificent cities to operate under the wisdom of the golden patterns. It is said that in addition to machines with fixed structures, the creatures known as Avatars of Lava are actually badly damaged lifeforms that were once created in the same way. However, after the flames of the sacred mountain were extinguished, most of them lost their sense of purpose and direction.

customize.text: A strange monster that needs to constantly absorb thermal energy to survive. However, it seems to damage itself should it absorb too much. After you <color=#ffe14b>use Pyro attacks</color> to cause it to fully enter an Overburn state, it will rapidly disintegrate.

dropMaterial.name: Mora
dropMaterial.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

dropMaterial.name: Ignited Stone
dropMaterial.desc:
A shard obtained from the body of a defeated Avatar of Lava.
Though it has been shattered to a great extent, on the inside, it still continues to burn. Perhaps this is a testament to the extraordinary vitality of phlogiston.

dropMaterial.name: Ignited Seed of Life
dropMaterial.desc:
A condensed pile of burning matter obtained from the body of a defeated Avatar of Lava.
It emits a slight heat.
Attempting to stop a stone pile of this size from incessantly burning away would be a hard task indeed. It is said that this is some primordial form of life.

dropMaterial.name: Ignited Seeing Eye
dropMaterial.desc:
A core retrieved from within the body of a defeated Avatar of Lava.
It emits a considerable heat.
It is said that once such a core has formed, left to itself, it will develop into a new Avatar of Lava. In ancient times, it was once believed that all forms of life could be traced back to conflagration, and that in the spark of burning matter lay the origins of the soul and sentient wisdom. Perhaps the very existence of Avatars of Lava would bear out such a belief â€” or perhaps it was the emergence of this theory itself that explains how they came to inhabit the land of Natlan...
